4 AWG baseline (no padding): 5 ft total = 2.5 ft red + 2.5 ft black. Source circuits: C-19A/C-19B (12V buffer battery path).

10 AWG pair-equivalent baseline for PV routing (no padding): 36 ft route total (~72 conductor-ft single-wire equivalent). Source circuit: C-27 (3x ~8 ft string legs + ~12 ft combiner-to-MPPT trunk, ASSUMED).
14 AWG duplex baseline (no padding): 44 ft total. Source circuits: C-20/C-21/C-22/C-23/C-35.
18/2 baseline usage (no padding): 18.5 ft total for C-24/C-25/C-26; practical purchase may require next spool size.

30A RV-style shore inlet baseline (with adapter policy for 15A/20A hookups); lock final NEMA/interface style during SKU phase.
30A shore cord plus 30A-to-15A and 30A-to-20A dogbone adapters for mixed pedestal/household hookups.
Two compact DIN enclosures: one AC-in enclosure for shore/EMS output landing + 30A input breaker, and one AC-out enclosure for branch distribution. Include rail hardware and cover hardware.

component: AC branch breaker set (AC-out-1 DIN UL489)
description_notes: DIN UL489 (or ETL/NRTL equivalent) branch breakers for AC-out-1: 20A galley branch + 15A office branch, with one spare position reserved in enclosure layout. AC-out-2 remains reserve-only in Phase 1.
Hardwired 120VAC EMS in shore path between TT-30 inlet and AC-in DIN enclosure. Baseline protections: open neutral, reverse polarity, and over/under-voltage events.
2x GFCI receptacles (first outlet on each AC-out-1 branch: galley + office). Use downstream feed-through protection where applicable.
2x duplex receptacles for downstream branch locations, giving 4 total receptacle locations with row 15 (2 galley, 2 office).
